In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s)
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " " * word
    end
    result *= "\n" * line  # Add the last line without newline character after loop ends.
    return result
end
```

You can call this function with a string and an optional text width as:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a sample sentence for testing purposes", 20))
```
The output will be:

```julia
"This is a sample
sentence for testing
purposes"
```
